LinkItem.internal_link_text: Elastic Scale Split and Merge Service Tutorial
Elastic Scale Split and Merge Service Tutorial
Export SSL Certificate From Certificate Store
Export SSL Certificate From Certificate Store
Upload SSL Certificate to Cloud Service
Upload SSL Certificate to Cloud Service
Update SSL Certificate in Service Configuration File
Update SSL Certificate in Service Configuration File
Upload SSL Certificate to Cloud Service
Upload SSL Certificate to Cloud Service
Update SSL Certificate in Service Configuration File
Update SSL Certificate in Service Configuration File

MarkdownCodeBlock.code_block: [Configure Allowed Clients in the Service Configuration File](Configure#Allowed#Clients#in#the#Service#Configuration#File)
[Configure Allowed Clients in the Service Configuration File](Configure#Allowed#Clients#in#the#Service#Configuration File)

MarkdownBlockBase.code_block: <EndpointAcls> <EndpointAcl role="SplitMergeWeb" endPoint="HttpIn" accessControl="DenyAll" /> <EndpointAcl role="SplitMergeWeb" endPoint="HttpsIn" accessControl="AllowAll" /> </EndpointAcls>

<AccessControl name="Retricted"> <Rule action="permit" description="Some" order="1" remoteSubnet="100.100.0.0/16"/> <Rule action="deny" description="None" order="2" remoteSubnet="0.0.0.0/0" /> </AccessControl> <EndpointAcls> <EndpointAcl role="SplitMergeWeb" endPoint="HttpsIn" accessControl="Restricted" />

MarkdownCodeBlock.code_block: Restrict number of concurrent requests per remote host (off by default)
Restrict rate of access per remote host (on by default)

MarkdownBlockBase.code_block: makecert ^ -n "CN=myservice.cloudapp.net" ^ -e MM/DD/YYYY ^ -r -cy end -sky exchange -eku "1.3.6.1.5.5.7.3.1" ^ -a sha1 -len 2048 ^ -sv MySSL.pvk MySSL.cer

MarkdownCodeBlock.code_block: -n with the service URL. Wildcards ("CN=*.cloudapp.net") and alternative names ("CN=myservice1.cloudapp.net, CN=myservice2.cloudapp.net") are supported.

MarkdownBlockBase.code_block: makecert ^ -n "CN=MyCA" ^ -e MM/DD/YYYY ^ -r -cy authority -h 1 ^ -a sha1 -len 2048 ^ -sr localmachine -ss my ^ MyCA.cer
makecert ^ -n "CN=My ID" ^ -e MM/DD/YYYY ^ -cy end -sky exchange -eku "1.3.6.1.5.5.7.3.2" ^ -a sha1 -len 2048 ^ -in "MyCA" -ir localmachine -is my ^ -sv MyID.pvk MyID.cer
MyID.pvk and MyID.cer with the filename for the client certificate
MyID.pvk and MyID.cer with the filename for the encryption certificate

MarkdownCodeBlock.code_block: You will need the password when uploading the certificate to the cloud service.
Export certificate into a .PFX file with these options:
Include all certificates in the certification path if possible
Enter the password protecting the private key
Select "Place" certificates in the following store

Click **Finish**.
* If the Trusted Root Certification Authority store was chosen, click **Yes**.
